content:
Photosynthesis Overview:
Photosynthesis is the process by which plants convert light energy into chemical energy.

Key Components:
• Chlorophyll - green pigment that captures light
• Carbon dioxide - from atmosphere
• Water - absorbed by roots
• Sunlight - energy source

Chemical Equation:
6CO2 + 6H2O + light energy → C6H12O6 + 6O2

Two Main Stages:
1. Light-dependent reactions (occur in thylakoids)
2. Light-independent reactions (Calvin cycle in stroma)

Importance:
- Produces oxygen for atmosphere
- Forms base of food chain
- Removes CO2 from atmosphere
summary:
Photosynthesis is the process by which plants convert light energy into chemical energy
• Chlorophyll - green pigment that captures light
• Carbon dioxide - from atmosphere
• Water - absorbed by roots
• 6CO2 + 6H2O + light energy → C6H12O6 + 6O2

keyPoints.text: Photosynthesis is the process by which plants convert light energy into chemical energy
Chlorophyll - green pigment that captures light

content:
Newton's Laws of Motion

First Law (Law of Inertia):
An object at rest stays at rest, and an object in motion stays in motion at constant velocity, unless acted upon by an unbalanced force.

Second Law:
F = ma
The acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the net force acting on it and inversely proportional to its mass.

Third Law:
For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.

Applications:
- Rocket propulsion
- Walking (push against ground)
- Car braking systems
- Sports mechanics
summary:
Newton's Laws of Motion
• First Law (Law of Inertia): An object at rest stays at rest, and an object in motion stays in motion at constant velocity, unless acted upon by an unbalanced force
• Second Law: F = ma
• Third Law: For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction

keyPoints.text: First Law (Law of Inertia): An object at rest stays at rest, and an object in motion stays in motion at constant velocity, unless acted upon by an unbalanced force
Third Law: For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction
